talk.author: did:plc:42er57tl3tymmbr5pxxzsyr6
talk.utter: I wouldn't have given this specific info. Be careful. Or are they simply physically labeled as such but not identified that way on any networks or in any code.

talk.author: did:plc:5vmkw5e5if7sespehv5sp7tl
talk.utter: It's all open info. Devs need to be able to send HTTP requests to the PDSs for certain use cases. But there's nothing truly private in there.

talk.author: did:plc:42er57tl3tymmbr5pxxzsyr6
talk.utter: I say this only because of how it can be exploited depending on configuration. So my hope is that what devs send HTTP requests to is just the public name, but internally there's a private name or IP that requests are routed to, and firewall is set so only authorized traffic gets private IP.
